items.title: New York Times columnist David Brooks appears in latest Epstein photos
items.standfirst: Brooks, who dismissed Epstein scandal as ‘stupid story’, wrote column expressing lack of interest in developmentsThe New York Times columnist David Brooks appeared in multiple photos from the estate of Jeffrey Epstein that were released on Thursday by the House committee on oversight and government reform.The photos, which have been rolled out in batches by the minority Democrats in the committee, lack crucial context, including dates and locations. But the photos appear to show Brooks attending a lunch or dinner event. Brooks is shown seated next to Sergey Brin, the co-founder of Google. Continue reading...

But the photos appear to show Brooks attending a lunch or dinner event. Brooks is shown seated next to Sergey Brin, the co-founder of Google. Continue reading...

items.title: Starmer appoints career diplomat Christian Turner as US ambassador
items.standfirst: Current ambassador to UN replaces Peter Mandelson, who was forced to quit over his links to Jeffrey EpsteinKeir Starmer has appointed the career diplomat Christian Turner as the UK’s ambassador to Washington, replacing Peter Mandelson who was forced to quit over his links to Jeffrey Epstein.Turner, who was appointed ambassador to the UN in May, had previously been political director at the Foreign Office and had brokered a close relationship with the new Labour administration before taking up his UN role in New York. clusters.title: Trump administration unveils plans to end gender-affirming care for minors
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump administration unveils plans to end gender-affirming care for minors

items.title: Trump administration unveils plans to end gender-affirming care for minors
items.standfirst: Proposal would prohibit Medicaid funds from being used to cover puberty blockers, hormone treatments or surgical proceduresUS politics live – latest updatesThe Trump administration unveiled new actions aimed at eliminating transition-related medical care for minors across the US on Thursday, referring to such treatments as “sex-rejecting procedures”, a term used by the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS).As part of the effort, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services will initiate a rule-making process that would prevent hospitals from offering puberty blockers, hormone treatments, or surgical procedures to minors if they wish to participate in Medicare or Medicaid. Continue reading...
items.content: Proposal would prohibit Medicaid funds from being used to cover puberty blockers, hormone treatments or surgical proceduresUS politics live – latest updatesThe Trump administration unveiled new actions aimed at eliminating transition-related medical care for minors across the US on Thursday, referring to such treatments as “sex-rejecting procedures”, a term used by the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS).As part of the effort, the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services will initiate a rule-making process that would prevent hospitals from offering puberty blockers, hormone treatments, or surgical procedures to minors if they wish to participate in Medicare or Medicaid. Continue reading...

items.content: The Trump administration Thursday proposed two rules targeting hospitals that treat transgender children and youth using Medicare and Medicaid as the lever. The move would affect trans youth who have private insurance, too.(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)

clusters.title: Brazil's Lula open to delaying EU-Mercosur deal as Europeans wrangle over trade pact
clusters.neutral_headline: Angry farmers block Brussels roads with tractors over Mercosur trade deal

items.title: Brazil's Lula open to delaying EU-Mercosur deal as Europeans wrangle over trade pact
items.standfirst: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva says he will present Italy's request for a postponement of a contentious EU trade deal with South America's Mercosur bloc to a summit of regional leaders at the weekend, amid French-led opposition to signing the mammoth transatlantic free-trade pact that sparked angry protests by farmers in Brussels on Thursday.
items.content: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva says he will present Italy's request for a postponement of a contentious EU trade deal with South America's Mercosur bloc to a summit of regional leaders at the weekend, amid French-led opposition to signing the mammoth transatlantic free-trade pact that sparked angry protests by farmers in Brussels on Thursday.

items.content: Thousands protest as EU leaders clash over pact farmers fear will flood Europe with cheaper South American goods.

clusters.title: State Department announces $10 billion-plus arms sales package to Taiwan, angering China
clusters.neutral_headline: US announces more than $10bn of arms sales to Taiwan

items.title: State Department announces $10 billion-plus arms sales package to Taiwan, angering China
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump's administration has announced a massive package of arms sales to Taiwan valued at more than $10 billion that includes medium-range missiles, howitzers and drones, drawing an angry response from China.
items.content: President Donald Trump's administration has announced a massive package of arms sales to Taiwan valued at more than $10 billion that includes medium-range missiles, howitzers and drones, drawing an angry response from China.

items.title: US announces more than $10bn of arms sales to Taiwan
items.standfirst: Package includes medium-range missiles, howitzers and drones, and has drawn an angry response from ChinaThe maps that show how China’s military is squeezing TaiwanThe Trump administration has announced a massive package of arms sales to Taiwan valued at more than $10bn that includes medium-range missiles, howitzers and drones, drawing an angry response from China.The state department announced the sales late on Wednesday during a nationally televised address by president Donald Trump, who made scant mention of foreign policy issues and did not speak about China or Taiwan at all. US-Chinese tensions have ebbed and flowed during Trump’s second term, largely over trade and tariffs but also over China’s increasing aggressiveness toward Taiwan, which Beijing has said must unify with the People’s Republic of China. Continue reading...
items.content: Package includes medium-range missiles, howitzers and drones, and has drawn an angry response from ChinaThe maps that show how China’s military is squeezing TaiwanThe Trump administration has announced a massive package of arms sales to Taiwan valued at more than $10bn that includes medium-range missiles, howitzers and drones, drawing an angry response from China.The state department announced the sales late on Wednesday during a nationally televised address by president Donald Trump, who made scant mention of foreign policy issues and did not speak about China or Taiwan at all. US-Chinese tensions have ebbed and flowed during Trump’s second term, largely over trade and tariffs but also over China’s increasing aggressiveness toward Taiwan, which Beijing has said must unify with the People’s Republic of China. Continue reading...

items.title: Micron Rallies as Outlook Shows Relentless Demand
items.standfirst: Shares of Micron Technology Inc., the largest US maker of computer memory chips, rose by the most in eight months after the company gave an upbeat forecast for the current quarter, signaling that surging demand and supply shortages are allowing the company to charge more for products. items.standfirst: Shares of Micron Technology Inc., the largest US maker of computer memory chips, rose by the most in eight months after the company gave an upbeat forecast for the current quarter, signaling that surging demand and supply shortages are allowing the company to charge more for products.

clusters.title: Zelensky gives stark warning as EU leaders decide on Russia's frozen assets
clusters.neutral_headline: Zelensky gives stark warning as EU leaders decide on Russia's frozen assets

items.title: Zelensky gives stark warning as EU leaders decide on Russia's frozen assets
items.standfirst: The EU is deciding whether to loan tens of billions of euros of Russian money to fund Ukraine's military and economic needs.
items.content: The EU is deciding whether to loan tens of billions of euros of Russian money to fund Ukraine's military and economic needs.

items.title: ‘Ukraine needs this money’ : Zelensky is in Brussels for talks on Russian assets
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky was in Brussels for a key European Union summit, where EU leaders faced a critical decision on the use of frozen Russian assets. Zelensky urged the bloc to release the funds to support Ukraine, warning that without this financial assistance, the country risks a catastrophic economic and military situation amid its ongoing conflict with Russia. FRANCE 24’s journalists Doug Herbert and Dave Keating have this analysis.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky was in Brussels for a key European Union summit, where EU leaders faced a critical decision on the use of frozen Russian assets. Zelensky urged the bloc to release the funds to support Ukraine, warning that without this financial assistance, the country risks a catastrophic economic and military situation amid its ongoing conflict with Russia. FRANCE 24’s journalists Doug Herbert and Dave Keating have this analysis.

clusters.title: North Korea stole billions in crypto in 2025, new research says
clusters.neutral_headline: North Korea stole billions in crypto in 2025, new research says

items.title: North Korea stole billions in crypto in 2025, new research says
items.standfirst: For the second year in a row, North Korea’s vast cryptocurrency hacking operation has broken its own record, stealing $2.02 billion in 2025, new research says
items.content: For the second year in a row, North Korea’s vast cryptocurrency hacking operation has broken its own record, stealing $2.02 billion in 2025, new research says

items.title: North Korea Stole $2 Billion of Crypto This Year, Report Says
items.standfirst: North Korean hackers stole a record $2 billion of crypto this year, researchers said, a sharp jump from 2024 that underscores the country’s growing ability to pull off massive heists.
items.content: North Korean hackers stole a record $2 billion of crypto this year, researchers said, a sharp jump from 2024 that underscores the country’s growing ability to pull off massive heists.

clusters.title: US strike on alleged drug boat in Pacific kills four, as Trump accuses Venezuela of taking ‘our oil’
clusters.neutral_headline: U.S. military announces another strike on suspected drug boat that killed 4

items.title: US strike on alleged drug boat in Pacific kills four, as Trump accuses Venezuela of taking ‘our oil’
items.standfirst: Hegseth announcement comes day after Trump blockades all sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving VenezuelaThe US military carried out a lethal strike on a vessel it said was engaged in drug trafficking in the eastern Pacific, according to the defense secretary, Pete Hegseth, as Trump further ratcheted up pressure on Venezuela, accusing the country of taking US oil.On Wednesday Hegseth said the “lethal kinetic strike” on a vessel engaged in “narco-trafficking operations” had killed four people. The latest strike in the Pacific brings the death toll to 99 since the US began its campaign of striking alleged drug-trafficking boats in September. Continue reading...
items.content: Hegseth announcement comes day after Trump blockades all sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving VenezuelaThe US military carried out a lethal strike on a vessel it said was engaged in drug trafficking in the eastern Pacific, according to the defense secretary, Pete Hegseth, as Trump further ratcheted up pressure on Venezuela, accusing the country of taking US oil.On Wednesday Hegseth said the “lethal kinetic strike” on a vessel engaged in “narco-trafficking operations” had killed four people. The latest strike in the Pacific brings the death toll to 99 since the US began its campaign of striking alleged drug-trafficking boats in September. Continue reading...

items.title: U.S. military announces another strike on suspected drug boat that killed 4
items.standfirst: A U.S. military strike killed four people on a suspected drug vessel in international waters in the eastern Pacific, defense officials said Wednesday
items.content: A U.S. military strike killed four people on a suspected drug vessel in international waters in the eastern Pacific, defense officials said Wednesday
